title: Movie Stars and Their Friendship
summary: Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi are actors in a new movie called Wuthering Heights. They play characters who are in love in the story. While talking about the movie, they have said nice things about each other, like calling it a 'mutual obsession.' Some fans think this is fun and exciting, but others feel it is 'weird' or gives them 'the ick,' which means it makes them uncomfortable. People wonder if the actors are just being friendly or if they are doing this to help promote the movie. The article looks at what they have said and done, like giving roses on Valentine's Day, to see if it is real or just for publicity. It also mentions other movies where actors might have done similar things to get attention.

keywords.explanation: when two people are very interested in each other
people who like and support the actors
to help make something popular or well-known
attention from the media or public
a special day for showing love and friendship

background_read: This article is about actors Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi, who are starring in a new film adaptation of Wuthering Heights, a classic love story by Emily Brontë. In movies, actors often talk about their roles and each other to get people excited about the film. Sometimes, they might say or do things that make fans wonder if they are just pretending or if it is real. This can help create buzz and make more people want to watch the movie. The article explores how this happens and what fans think about it.
Article_Structure: WHO: Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi, actors in the movie Wuthering Heights
WHAT: They have said nice things about each other, like having a 'mutual obsession,' which some fans find weird or uncomfortable
WHERE: This happens during interviews and promotions for the movie
WHY: To see if their behavior is real or just to promote the film and get attention

perspectives.description: Some fans think the actors' behavior is fun and adds to the movie's appeal.
Other fans find it 'weird' or 'tacky' and think it might be fake for publicity.
